body:
# console.cr
[![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://chris-huxtable.github.io/console.cr/)
[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/chris-huxtable/console.cr.svg)](https://github.com/chris-huxtable/console.cr/releases)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/chris-huxtable/console.cr.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/chris-huxtable/console.cr)

Easy to use output control allowing redirection and buffering.


## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  console:
    github: chris-huxtable/console.cr
```


## Usage

```crystal
require "console"
```

### Printing to the Console:

```crystal
Console.print("This will print without a newline")
Console.line("This will print with a newline")
Console.line("This will", "print separate strings, with", "a newline", separator: ' ')
Console.words("This", "will", "print", "words", "or strings", "separated by single spaces", "and without a newline")

Console.print("All also feature", separator: "with different defaults", terminator: '.')
```

### Printing lists to the Console:

```crystal
Console.item("This is a list label")
#=> " - This is a list label\n"
Console.item("This is a list label", "with extras", justify: 30)
#=> " - This is a list label       with extras\n"

Console.item("This is a red list label", "with extras", justify: 30, style: Console::Style::Red)
#=> " - This is a red list label   with extras\n"

Console.status("This is a list label")
#=> " - This is a list label\n"
Console.status("This is a list label", "with a status", justify: 30)
#=> " - This is a list label       with a status\n"
Console.status("This is a red list label", "with a red status", justify: 30, style: Console::Style::Red)
#=> " - This is a list label       with a red status\n"
```

### Printing to a buffer:

```crystal
buffer = Console.buffer() {
	Console.line("This will be printed to the buffer")
	Console.line("Which will return a string")

	Console.repeat('=', 50)
	Console.newline()

	Console.line("You could then print it to the actual console if needed")
}

Console << buffer if something.went_wrong?
```


## Notes

- 'Monkey patches' `IO::Memory.truncate`
- Currently not `fork` or thread/fiber safe.


## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/chris-huxtable/console.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request


## Contributors

- [Chris Huxtable](https://github.com/chris-huxtable) - creator, maintainer

def.body:
string.to_s(@@output)
return Console

def.name: capture_style
def.body: @@capture_style

def.name: capture_style=
def.body: @@capture_style = capture_style

def.name: delete
flush
def.body: @@output.flush

class_methods.name: heading
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, separator = ' ', terminator = ':') : Console.class

def.name: heading
def.body:
stylize(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator, styles: HEADING_STYLE)
newline()
return Console

def.name: heading
def.body:
heading(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator)
passthrough = yield
newline()
return passthrough

class_methods.name: item
class_methods.args_string: (label, extra = nil, justify : Int = 0, *, symbol = '-', separator : Char = ' ', style : StyleTypes? = nil) : Console.class

def.name: item
def.body:
if (Console.silenced?)
  return Console
end
if (extra)
  label = label.to_s
end
Console.stylize(style) do
  Console.print(' ', symbol, ' ')
  Console.print(label)
end
if !extra
  return Console.newline
end
if (justify > 0)
  Console.offset(label, symbol, separator, justify)
end
if (extra)
  Console.print(extra)
end
return Console.newline

class_methods.name: line
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, separator = nil, terminator = '\n') : Console.class

def.name: line
newline
def.body: return repeat('\n', count)

def.name: output
def.body:
tmp = @@output
begin
  flush()
  @@output = output
  yield
ensure
  flush()
  @@output = tmp
end

def.name: output=
def.body:
flush()
@@output = output

class_methods.name: print
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, separator = nil, terminator = nil) : Console.class

def.name: print
repeat
def.body:
if (silenced? || count <= 0)
  return Console
end
count.times do
  @@output << string
end
return Console

def.name: silence
def.body:
@@silence = @@silence + 1
return Console

def.name: silenced
def.body:
begin
  silence()
  yield
  return self
ensure
  unsilence()
end

def.name: silenced?
def.body: return (@@silence > 0)

class_methods.name: status
class_methods.args_string: (label, status, justify : Int = 0, *, separator : Char = ' ', symbol = '-', style : StyleTypes? = nil) : Console.class

def.name: status
def.body:
if (Console.silenced?)
  return Console
end
label = label.to_s
Console.print(' ', symbol, ' ')
Console.print(label)
if (justify > 0)
  Console.offset(label, symbol, separator, justify)
end
Console.stylize(style) do
  Console.print(status)
end
return Console.newline

def.name: stylize
def.body:
Style.print(styles) do
  yield
end
return Console

class_methods.name: stylize
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, styles : StyleTypes?, separator = nil, terminator = nil) : Console.class

def.name: stylize
def.body:
Style.print(*strings, styles: styles, separator: separator, terminator: terminator)
return Console

def.name: stylize=
def.body: @@stylize = value

def.name: stylize?
def.body:
retval = @@stylize
if (!retval.nil?)
  return retval
end
return tty?

class_methods.name: sub_heading
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, separator = ' ', terminator = ':') : Console.class

def.name: sub_heading
def.body:
stylize(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator, styles: SUB_HEADING_STYLE)
newline()

def.name: sub_heading
def.body:
sub_heading(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator)
return yield

def.name: to_buffer
def.body:
buffer = IO::Memory.new
output(buffer) do
  yield
end
return buffer.to_s

def.name: to_error
def.body:
output(STDERR) do
  yield
end

def.name: tty?
def.body: return @@output.tty?

def.name: unsilence
def.body:
if (silenced?())
  @@silence = @@silence - 1
end
return Console

class_methods.name: words
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, separator = ' ', terminator = nil) : Console.class

def.name: words

class_methods.name: item
class_methods.args_string: (label, extra = nil, justify : Int = 0, *, symbol = '+', separator : Char = ' ', strong : Bool = false) : Console.class

def.name: item
def.body: return Console.item(label, extra, justify, symbol: symbol, separator: separator, style: styling(strong: strong))

class_methods.name: each
class_methods.args_string: (command : String, args = nil, *, env : Process::Env? = nil, clear_env : Bool = true, shell : Bool = false, input = CLOSE, error : Bool = false, delimiter : Char | String = '\n', chomp : Bool = true, &block : String -> Nil) : Bool

def.name: each
def.body:
return capture_worker(command, args, env: env, clear_env: clear_env, shell: shell, input: input, error: error, delimiter: delimiter, chomp: chomp) do |line|
  yield line
end

class_methods.name: print
class_methods.args_string: (command : String, args = nil, *, env : Process::Env? = nil, clear_env : Bool = true, shell : Bool = false, prefix : String? = " > ", input = CLOSE, error : Bool = false) : Bool

def.name: print
def.body:
return capture_worker(command, args, env: env, clear_env: clear_env, shell: shell, input: input, error: error, chomp: false) do |line|
  Style.begin(Console.capture_style)
  if prefix
    Console << prefix
  end
  Console << line
  Style.end
end

class_methods.name: string
class_methods.args_string: (command : String, args = nil, *, env : Process::Env? = nil, clear_env : Bool = true, shell : Bool = false, input = CLOSE, error : Bool = false) : Tuple(String?, Bool)

def.name: string
def.body:
string = nil
success = capture_worker(command, args, env: env, clear_env: clear_env, shell: shell, input: input, error: error, delimiter: nil) do |value|
  string = value
end
return {string, success}

def.name: style
def.body:
string.to_s.each_line(false) do |line|
  Style.begin(Console.capture_style)
  if prefix
    Console << prefix
  end
  Console << line
  Style.end
end

class_methods.name: fatal
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, code : Int = 1, separator = " ", terminator = "\n") : Nil

def.name: fatal
def.body:
strongly(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator)
exit(code)

class_methods.name: item
class_methods.args_string: (label, extra = nil, justify : Int = 0, *, symbol = 'x', separator = ' ', strong : Bool = false) : Console.class

def.name: item
def.body: return Console.item(label, extra, justify, symbol: symbol, separator: separator, style: styling(strong: strong))

def.name: begin
def.body:
if (((!style) || Console.silenced?) || (!Console.stylize?))
  return Style
end
Console << "\e["
Console << style
Console << 'm'
return Style

def.name: begin
def.body:
if (Console.silenced? || (!Console.stylize?))
  return Style
end
Console.print("\e[")
styles.each_with_index do |elem, i|
  if i > 0
    Console << ';'
  end
  Console << elem
end
Console << 'm'
return Style

def.name: end
def.body:
if (Console.silenced? || (!Console.stylize?))
  return Style
end
Console.print("\e[0m")
return Style

class_methods.name: print
class_methods.args_string: (*strings, styles : StyleTypes?, separator = nil, terminator = nil) : Style.class

def.name: print
def.body:
if ((Console.silenced? || strings.empty?) || (!styles))
  return Style
end
print(styles) do
  Console.internal_print(*strings, separator: separator, terminator: terminator)
end
return Style

def.name: print
def.body:
if (styles.empty? || (!Console.stylize?))
  yield
  return Style
end
Style.begin(styles)
yield
Style.end
return Style

def.name: print
def.body:
Style.begin(style)
yield
if (style)
  Style.end
end
return Style

def.name: black?
def.body: self == Black

def.name: blink?
def.body: self == Blink

def.name: blue?
def.body: self == Blue

def.name: bold?
def.body: self == Bold

def.name: cyan?
def.body: self == Cyan

def.name: faint?
def.body: self == Faint

def.name: green?
def.body: self == Green

def.name: grey?
def.body: self == Grey

def.name: intense?
def.body: self == Intense

def.name: itaic?
def.body: self == Itaic

def.name: magenta?
def.body: self == Magenta

def.name: red?
def.body: self == Red

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a `String` representation of this enum member to the given *io*.

See also: `to_s`.
instance_methods.summary: Appends a String representation of this enum member to the given io.

def.name: to_s
def.body: io << value

def.name: underline?
def.body: self == Underline

def.name: white?
def.body: self == White

def.name: yellow?
def.body: self == Yellow

class_methods.name: item
class_methods.args_string: (label, extra = nil, justify : Int = 0, *, symbol = '~', separator : Char = ' ', strong : Bool = false) : Console.class

def.name: item
def.body: return Console.item(label, extra, justify, symbol: symbol, separator: separator, style: styling(strong: strong))
